p.s: Description of Solimonas flava comb. nov.
Solimonas flava (fla′va. L. fem. adj. flava yellow, the colour of colonies or the pigment that the bacterium produces).
Basonym: Sinobacter flavus Zhou et al. 2008.
The description is as given for the genus Sinobacter and for Sinobacter flavus by Zhou et al. (2008), with the addition that the type strain is facultatively anaerobic and catalase-positive.

In addition to those given in the emended genus description, the polar lipids include phosphatidyldimethylethanolamine, three uncharacterized phospholipids and two further uncharacterized aminophospholipids.
The type strain, CW-KD 4T ( = DSM 18980T = KCTC 12881T = CCTCC AB 206145T), was isolated from the surface layer of a polluted farmland soil from Nanjing, Jiangsu Province, China.
